propChildren: The content of the component, normally an `IconButton` or string.
propClasses: Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
propComponent:
The component used for the root node.
Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDisablePointerEvents:
Disable pointer events on the root.
This allows for the content of the adornment to focus the input on click.
propDisableTypography: If children is a string then disable wrapping in a Typography component.
propPosition: The position this adornment should appear relative to the `Input`.
propVariant:
The variant to use.
Note: If you are using the `TextField` component or the `FormControl` component
you do not have to set this manually.
stylesRoot: Styles applied to the root element.
stylesFilled: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="filled"`.
stylesPositionStart: Styles applied to the root element if `position="start"`.
stylesPositionEnd: Styles applied to the root element if `position="end"`.
stylesDisablePointerEvents: Styles applied to the root element if `disablePointerEvents=true`.
stylesHiddenLabel: Styles applied if the adornment is used inside <FormControl hiddenLabel />.
stylesMarginDense: Styles applied if the adornment is used inside <FormControl margin="dense" />.
